title: So, I've been experimenting with Trundle support
body:
One game, i ended up having to trundle supp because of a miss communication with the team in champ select.

So I just tried to play him as a tanky peeler for my adc. I maxed my pillar, and i build 40% cdr asap to have pillars every 6 seconds.


I will say that it went better than expected. Pillars are amazing peel and great for engage as well.


What do you all think about Trundle as a support?

He's an interesting kill lane support. But you should probably max Q. Bite the enemy carry, then bop them. You will win trades. :D

did this tonight in 2 more games.

won both.

went very well both times.

I tried this in Season 4 due to me wanting to try something stupid in the botlane, and for some reason my team was fine with me trying it.

It didn't work out well, but that was probably because I wasn't playing it properly. I was playing it more like I was playing Trundle top, and you can't really do that in a duo lane and without getting any CS. I was maxing pillar first, but the rest of the time I was playing far too aggressively for a melee support with no gapclosers.

I should try this again.
Maybe try adc Trundle? =)

Considering Trundle's Kit, I'd think he'd be really good against the more tanky style supports like Braum and Leona. In 2v2 fights, he Ult's the enemy support, then Q's the enemy ADC, then starts walloping as much as he can. I'd think he'd be more a counter pick than a core support, but I'd say it's worth it.

Well, Trundle is more suited for a top lane position. Coupled with natural tankiness and sustain, he belongs by himself. Trundle is pretty much the King of Duelers, and should be treated as such. A single slow that you can walk out of rather quickly, at least to me, doesn't make him a support.
